metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10963 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The TIFFWriteDirectorySec() function in tif_dirwrite.c in LibTIFF through 4.0.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application crash) via a crafted file, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-13726.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.1
libtiff-tools - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.1
libtiff5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.1
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.9-5ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.9-5ubuntu0.1').
